intro: Valeriana reitziana, commonly known as Reitz's valerian, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. Its rhizomatous root system is notable for containing compounds that have been traditionally used in herbal medicine. Valeriana reitziana prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a suitable candidate for garden cultivation in warm climates.
